problems.title: Maximum Deletions on a String (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given a string s consisting of only lowercase English letters. In one operation, you can:

Delete the entire string s, or
Delete the first i letters of s if the first i letters of s are equal to the following i letters in s, for any i in the range 1 <= i <= s.length / 2.

Return the maximum number of operations needed to delete all of s.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcabcdabc

Sample Output
2

Explanation: Delete the first 3 letters ("abc") since the next 3 letters are equal. Now, s = "abcdabc". Then delete all the letters.

Sample Input
aaabaab

Sample Output
4

Explanation: Delete operations: "a", "aab", "a", then all letters.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 4000
s consists only of lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Use dynamic programming to find the maximum deletions.
For each position, check if a prefix matches the following substring.
